steps.title: Test 1 – Invoice Creation : Bill From section
details: Step 2 – Expected “Bill From:” block never appears → test stops here (hard failure).

steps.title: Test 2 – Invoice Creation : Bill To section
details: Step 1 – Landing page opens (pass, but UI-review flags poor placeholder copy).
Step 2 – “Bill To:” heading not found within 5 s → hard failure.

steps.title: Test 3 – Template System : Template selection
details: Step 1 – Landing page opens (pass, UI-review notes inconsistent button styling).
Step 2 – Header text (“BETA English Toggle theme”) not visible → hard failure.

steps.title: Test 4 – Template System : Logo upload
details: Step 1 – Landing page opens (pass, UI-review notes missing logo control).
Step 2 – Can’t find template/logo-upload area → hard failure.

emotional_arc: Starts curious/confident when the site loads. Quickly turns to confusion when the expected wizard or controls aren’t visible. Repeated time-outs create frustration and doubt about site reliability. Because no task can be completed, the session ends in disappointment and low trust.

qualitative_opportunities.area: First-run flow / discoverability of Invoice Wizard
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users expect to start creating an invoice immediately; hiding the wizard or requiring an undiscoverable click creates an early abandonment risk.
next_actions: Auto-launch Step 1 after landing or surface a prominent “Create Invoice” CTA.
Add a visible progress indicator while wizard assets load.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Section headings used as primary selectors ("Bill From :", "Bill To :")
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Extra spaces/colons or copy edits break automated tests and confuse AT users; can also hurt localisation.
next_actions: Replace brittle text selectors with stable data-testids / ARIA-labels.
Standardise heading copy without trailing spaces/colon.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Placeholders guide users; non-informative lorem text looks unfinished and reduces professionalism.
next_actions: Provide meaningful examples (e.g., “Acme Corp, 123 Main St”).
Audit all inputs for helpful micro-copy.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Visual consistency of buttons and controls
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Inconsistent sizing/styling decreases perceived polish and can impact trust.
next_actions: Define a button component in design system; apply consistently across templates.
Run visual regression tests after each template addition.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Branding the invoice is a key value prop; if users can’t find the feature they’ll assume it’s missing.
next_actions: Place the logo control near template preview with an upload icon & “Add logo” label.
Add tooltip/help text describing accepted formats and size.
Persist uploaded logo across template switches.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: 5-second time-outs suggest the UI might be slow or scripts heavy; users perceive slowness as instability.
next_actions: Measure real world TTI for wizard sections; optimise or add skeleton loaders.

first_tackles.description: Add stable data-testid / aria-labels to key sections (Bill From, Bill To, template picker, logo uploader) to stop hard failures and improve accessibility.
Expose a clear, immediate “Create Invoice” button that launches the wizard without extra clicks.
Replace placeholder/lorem copy with concrete examples across all input fields.
Standardise button styles via a shared component so all templates look coherent.
Make the logo upload control obvious (icon + label) and ensure the logo persists when switching templates.
